author: Deccan
title: Gajendran adjudged as CTA head
text: Deccan Chronicle | October 05, 2015, 06.21 am TP Gajendran Popular filmmaker-producer TP Gajendran, who is known for making family dramas and later turned a comedy actor, has now been chosen as the president of Cinema Technicians Association (CTA). He was adjudged the post at a General Body meeting held recently at the traditional association which commenced 75 years ago. The veteran was unanimously selected for the responsible post and he promised to work towards the welfare of its members. Gajendran was an assistant to veteran filmmaker M R Viswanthan and his last directorial venture was the 2010 release Magane En Marumagane which had Vivek and Nasser in prominent roles. entertainment Kollywood TP Gajendran Also Read Ameethâ€™s got his groove on Superstar Rajinikanth is back with a bang in new 'Lingaa' teaser When B-town turned bitter tweet Just Married: Dia Mirza and Sahil Sangha enter new phase of their life
